nodes.text: Fried-nuna was a type of food made from nunas, omnivore birds native to the planet Naboo. Around 56 BBY, Czerka Corporation slave Rahara Wick escaped her captivity by stealing a knife from a fried-nuna vendor to cut out her slave chip while on the planet Ord Mantell. Years later, she would recall the experience and remember the pain of the knife's cut, but felt no regret.
Fried-nuna was first mentioned in Master & Apprentice, a 2019 novel by Claudia Gray.
